answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!Your sister is probably suffering from complications of diabetes. She appears to be having uncontrolled diabetes. This may have resulted in peripheral neuropathies, and mini strokes. She may also have had a stroke at some point or likely to have. There may be associated hypothyroidism. Her kidney function should also be assessed. If she is not on insulin already, she may be benefit from insulin.Please look up in the local directories for an endocrine or a diabetes specialist. You can also ask around in your friend circle. Your sister should also be shown to a neurologist.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: My sister who is 37, single mother of 2, diabetic for 27 years has been very sick for 2 years.  She has been to many doctors and specialists who can't seem to find anything wrong with her.  Some of her symptoms include chronic fatigue, unexplained weight gain, migraines, entire left side of her body is very weak all the time, and whatever she has also effects her voice making it weak and faint.  Her condition is deteriorating rapidly and her symptoms are increasing.  Can anyone relate to these symptoms or at least tell me where I can find someone who specializes in diagnostic medicine in the Chicago land area???
title: Desperate and Undiagnosed for 2 years
